instructions: Resolve 57 lint/type errors reported by available tools.
Increase test coverage with more assertions.

PRIORITY: Increase test coverage from 7.14% to at least 90.00%.
PRIORITY: Improve mutation score from 0.00% to at least 50.00%.
Coverage: Identify and write tests for all functions in the codebase, especially those with complex logic (e.g., functions with high cyclomatic complexity).
Coverage: Focus on testing edge cases for the single class present, ensuring all methods are invoked with various input scenarios.
Coverage: Add unit tests for error handling paths, particularly for any functions that deal with user input or external data.

Mutation: Create tests that specifically target conditional branches in the code to ensure that mutants are killed. For example, if there are if-else statements, ensure tests cover both true and false conditions.
Mutation: Implement tests that modify the state of the application to check for side effects, which can help in killing more mutants.
Mutation: Use a mutation testing tool to identify specific lines of code that are not adequately tested and create targeted tests for those lines.
Quality: Address the 57 lint issues by following the style guide (e.g., PEP 8) to improve readability and maintainability.
Quality: Refactor the code to reduce complexity; consider breaking down large functions into smaller, more manageable ones.
